Fields.DialogueText: Where could it have gone?
Looking for something, Shigure?
Do not worry, Kanchou. It's not the end of the world if I go without for a few days.
Well, all right. If you're sure.
Or a few weeks. Maybe a month. The last time I mislaid something, it was missing for...

Fields.MenuText: I can't help you if you don't tell me what you lost.
I'm sure it'll turn up eventually. It can't have left the ship.
You need to be more careful with your things.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! I suppose that would help. Though it is a bit... embarrassing.
Maybe it has. I don't really understand how it works, you see...
I know, but no matter how hard I try, they just disappear sometimes.
*ALARM*
Oh! Do you hear that? It's very loud.
The Morgana alarm. We'll look for your... whatever it is after the battle.
@BATTLE
That takes care of that. What were you looking for earlier?
I seem to have lost my omamori.
Don't you have a few of those good luck charms?
Hai, but this one was special. It was supposed to keep me from losing things.
That's unfortunate.
You don't think the Funayūrei destroyed it, do you? What if I lose my other things? What if we're separated from the fleet? What if...
Calm down. What's that on your back?
What? Oh! Arigatō, Kanchou!
Ha! I guess it was there the whole time.
Imagine that.
This just proves its effectiveness, doesn't it? I never lost it to begin with!
Keep telling yourself that.
Shigure, where are you? We're headed into Morgana territory!
Friend or foe?
What? I can't find you!
Friend or foe?
I don't know what you're talking about!
Yokatta... and now I can put this down.
What were you doing with that lamp?
What needed to be done. Or rather, what I imagined might be necessary at the time.
Necessary? I'm your captain! You don't wait to ambush me with a lamp.
But I just did. Didn't I?
You shouldn't. That's tantamount to treason.
Sumimasen! You know that the Funayūrei are deceptive and devious. I have heard stories from other Kami - and who knows what illusions they are capable of!?

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry. They're good, but not that good.
Read the mission brief next time instead of listening to rumors.
How do you know this isn't part of it?

Fields.DialogueText: That is a comfort to know. What can I trust if not my own senses?
I did, Kanchou! Today we are hunting the... oh, who were they again?
Kanchou, that is a cruel trick and you know it!
Arigatō gozaimasu.
Good. Now, we were getting close to where the enemy was last spotted. Meet me on the bridge.
Mistaken identity figures heavily in the plot of this one British play that I once...
Now.
Kashikomarimashita! Let's go!
@BATTLE
It's me. I'm not a Morgana. Let's get back to work, Shigure.
... and after Okinawa, our next destination is Shanghai. We'll need to keep the East China Sea open if we want to remain in contact with our allies there.
Hmm... difficult, isn't it?
Extremely. That Morgana blockade is causing difficulty.
Ano... hai. I see what you mean.
Shigure, have you been listening at all?
H-hai, of course!
What were we just talking about?
Mmm... Shanghai?
Good.
I must admit that the land war doesn't really cross my mind, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Well, it should. What happens there affects us too.
I agree. It's easy to get caught up in the immediate dangers.
I like your focus. The sooner we deal with the Morganas, the better.

Fields.DialogueText: True. I admit to knowing very little about China... though they are my neighbors. It might be nice to visit.
I suppose so? Sometimes it's hard enough to focus on those.
Hai. Focus. The Funayūrei. Hai.
That is your copy of the mission brief you're reading, isn't it?
Why... yes, of course!
Lay it down where I can see it.
Surely you don't...
Shigure, why have you been marking up the brief?
Sumimasen! I'd read over it six or seven times already, and then I noticed that there was this tanka-like cadence to the prose... see where I've outlined...
At least you've studied it. It should come in handy for these incoming Morganas.
@BATTLE
"Three hulking mountains / Beset by a northern storm / Which turns west after..."
Doing a little sightseeing?
Kanchou! I did not expect to see you there.
I could say the same of you. It's not often I find you out here on deck.
It is not often our paths cross. Some days I wonder if we aren't on different ships.
Shigure, you can sense me aboard you.
One sometimes feels pain in a limb they have lost. Memories have a strange power. Enough to lose oneself in them.
Uh... okay. I guess...
I took dinner the other day... in my quarters, naturally... and could have sworn I tasted curry, though I was eating salmon. Had I not checked, who would have said otherwise?
Ahem. What are you actually up to?
Oh! A little ritual of mine, Kanchou. I set down each new locale in a poem. It helps me to focus on the mission. Immortalizes it, really.

Fields.MenuText: It's about time you started focusing.
That poem is beautiful. What does it mean?
Does it? How does that help?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou. I know I can be a little bit of an airhead... but please hear me out.
The weather inspired me. Think of it this way...
It is a problem of perspective. I try to see so many at once. The verse forces one.
Now, aren't we a little like a storm, blowing one way and then another? Nigh unstoppable, yet... guided by forces yet more unstoppable?
Whoa. That's... amazing.
R-really? I... didn't mean it that way.
How did you mean it?
I hadn't really gotten that far.
*ALARM*
We'll come back to this. I'm intrigued, Shigure!
Arigatō? I think?
@BATTLE
Kuso! Ow...
Shigure, are you all right?
Hai... just a minor bruise. I've found my bearings now. Owww...
Where are your glasses?
I have been trying to answer that for the better part of the morning. I can't have taken them out of my quarters...
Then why aren't you looking for them there?
It's a bit of a problem for me, Kanchou. I've started leaving spares around the ship should I misplace my usual pair.
What about that good luck charm? The one that keeps you from losing things?
Um... I haven't lost it, if that's any consolation.

Fields.MenuText: What am I going to do with you, Shigure?
It must not be that powerful.
At least it's working. Maybe try another?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe help me look for my glasses? I'm useless without them...
Don't say such things, Kanchou! You'll spoil the blessing.
It will be due for a replacement before too long. I suppose I'll get by until then.
You'd better find them fast. One of our sister fleets in the area needs our help.
Oh, dear! I keep warning the younger Kami about being prepared.
Maybe it should be the other way around.
Wait! Hai! Kanchou, here they are!
Your glasses?
In my pocket the whole time! I told myself they would never be there. It's the first place I'd look. Why hide something somewhere so obvious?
Though on second thought, would that not be the best place to hide something?
I'm... not going to dwell on that.
Do not, Kanchou. Now we must fire shots as clear as my vision.
Shigure?
The wolves attack us / Little knowing the shepherd / Is an angry god.
@BATTLE
Shigure? Are you in there?
Konnichiwa, Kanchou.
Whoa! How long have you been there?
More to the point, why are you around that corner instead of in your quarters?
It's... it's nothing. No reason.
Come on, you can tell me.
Do you promise not to laugh?

Fields.MenuText: Do you promise not to give me a reason?
Of course. Why would I laugh?
Just tell me.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, dear. This is embarrassing...
I-if you're certain.
Well, if it makes sense to you...
Do you remember when I lost my glasses?
The most recent time? Yes.
Do you remember when I found them?
I'd kind of blocked that out. What came over you?
I don't know what it is. It's sort of a... superstition? I know I've got a lot of them.
Go on.
It's so hard to explain! When I lose something and find it again, I feel a certain... well, determination.
Like I've taken something back from fate. Or been given a chance to rewrite it.
How does that explain why you won't go back into your quarters?
Sumimasen... that is a different matter.
Saved by the bell. We've got company. Still have any of that courage?
I will try to find it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Konnichiwa, Kanchou.
Good day. Still creeping around?
W-well... a little further down, yes... Hai.

Fields.MenuText: All right, then. I won't force it.
You feel like telling me why?
Is the deck more comfortable in this spot?

Fields.DialogueText: You deserve to understand.
I suppose so. Let me try to explain...
Heh... maybe a little!
Consider it another ritual, Kanchou. If I have seen enough outside, I retreat below decks to discover what has changed within.
Has anything?
Ittōsuihei Kanagawa has a new haircut.
Riveting.
Hai! It is surprising what you can pull a verse or two out of.
So, then what happens?
I sit and write, a little further down the corridor each day. Eventually I will be topside again, by which time the world will show me a new face.
That's actually kind of beautiful. I like your creative process.
As do I. Although I do hope I get to the galley soon.
When was the last time you ate?
Before I started this ritual. Strictly speaking, I don't need to eat. But I'm so hungry...
The Morganas have other ideas. You probably have time to grab something before the shooting starts.
Īe... I'll be fine, Kanchou. I think.
@BATTLE
Finally make it to the galley?
Hai! And not a moment too soon! My vision was starting to blur...
I never thought I'd have to tell a ship to eat something.
Think nothing of it, Kanchou. The way things sort of tear at the edges when you're famished is a perspective I hadn't yet considered.

Fields.MenuText: Nor should you.
Is there any poetry in that?
You're a strange one, Shigure.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe it is something humans do not understand.
There is poetry in everything, if one only looks!
I know. Sometimes I wish I weren't, but it's the only way I know how to be.
Only think, Kanchou. If you could do things others couldn't... or didn't need to do things others did... wouldn't you want to know more about yourself?
Not to the point of starvation. I think it was even affecting our cruising speed.
That can happen? I wonder...
What was that stuff about knowing yourself?
I suppose I have a lot to learn.
Oh, well. Momiji tempura? Shared food tastes best.
Fried maple leaves? Interesting.
I made enough for two...
Thank you, Shigure. I'll gladly...
... hundred. Two hundred.
Where do you even get this many maple leaves at sea?
Hmm... Around. Here and there.
*ALARM*
Looks like we've got company. I might need a battle to clear my head.
@BATTLE
"The brink of hunger / Tears the world down around you / Yet picks up its mess."
Welcome back topside.
K-Kanchou! Where did you come from?
Just keeping a weather eye out.
Are you sure?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I'm sure. What kind of question is that?
I'm not really sure of anything when it comes to you.
Are you sure?

Fields.DialogueText: I think it's the most important one.
In some ways... isn't that a good thing?
Most days, not really.
Doesn't everything come down to whether or not you're certain?
Some things are indisputable. The weather, for one. Your location.
Unless you're lost.
We're not lost. We're in a stretch of Morgana territory that's bedeviled the Imperial Navy for weeks.
At least we know that much. I've managed to arrange the events of the last few days in an order that makes sense.
More poetry?
You really must try it sometime, Kanchou! I think it records one's state of mind in a way simple journaling does not. You must recall your inspiration for each verse to divine its meaning...
Sumimasen. I realize that must sound terribly boring...
Can I read some of your poetry sometime?
Hai. I mean... what? Wait, all of it? Or some of it?
Don't look so surprised. I want to know more about how you think.
At times even I don't know that.
Don't be so hard on yourself. We've got the Morganas for that.
Why, look over there! Are those the Funayūrei we've been pursuing?
Some days, I swear...
@BATTLE
Shigure, watch out!
Hmm? Aaa!
That was a close one. Are you all right?
Hai... I think so. They must be very angry with us. Why?
Worry about that when we're not dodging shells.
@BATTLE
I can't believe how close that shot was.
It singed the hem of my dress... see? Oh, it's going to take days to fix...
I'm just glad it missed. A little closer and... well, no need to dwell on it. Fine work today.
Arigatō, but I cannot take much credit. I just remembered this.

Fields.MenuText: Another good luck charm?

Fields.DialogueText: For keeping out of rain. I thought the prayer was similar enough to our situation to work.
Good luck charm or no, we came through that one better than I expected. Damage report?
Other than my dress... no serious injuries.
Maybe you really are lucky.
The other Kami have often told me so.

Fields.MenuText: A charm to protect your clothing?
A charm to remember all of your charms?

Fields.DialogueText: If I had one, my dress would be fine.
Do you have one like that I could borrow? Oh... you are teasing me!
This can't be right.
What can't be right?
Son of a... where did you come from?
I don't really see how that's relevant, but... I was laid down by the Uraga Dock Company in 1933, and launched in--
Don't be obtuse. I don't like your habit of sneaking up on people.
Sumimasen. I don't like intruding or interrupting, so I try to be quiet.
Never mind that. Have you noticed anything strange about the way we've been deployed?
Not that I am aware of. May I see that after action report?
Sure. Isn't it odd?
Oh, dear... it's just as I expected.
What's wrong?
You've noticed that we tend to sail further from the rest of the group during battle?
Yes, and I can't figure out why.
I read Command's orders closely. It's not that they want us there... it's that my sisters are avoiding me.

Fields.MenuText: That isn't right of them. We're all in this together.
That can't be. Why would they be avoiding you?
Look, you're a little bit strange. But this is war. I can't care about that.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe it is for the best.
I hate to bring up rumors again, but I promise I did not start them!
*sigh* I know, Kanchou.
Remember the close call from the last battle? I have something of a reputation for those. And others around me tend to get hurt. My sisters find it unnerving.
That's ridiculous. Nothing happened to me that day.
Fate is unpredictable. That's why it's fate.
Don't worry about it. We're going to fight the Morganas today and win, and we'll have no more of these rumors.
I fear the gods may feel differently...
@BATTLE
Don't tell me.
Anatana no, Kanchou? Please don't be mad!
What are you doing up here without your glasses?
I lost them again... this was such a terrible idea.
What do you mean, "terrible idea?"
Remember when I told you I hid spares around the ship?
You forgot where you hid them.
Hai... it's so embarrassing. But I thought if I were in dire straits again, I would find the ones I hid up here on the deck.
You lost your glasses on purpose?
It wasn't hard... unfortunately. Or fortunately. Maybe I am both lucky and unlucky.

Fields.MenuText: You'd better find them quickly. The enemy could strike any minute.
Do you want me to help you look for them?
Sometimes I don't know how you've survived this long.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm trying, but it's all so gray and blurry, like being in a snowstorm. There is a poem in that, I think...
Onegaishimasu... I have regretted this experiment for an hour now.
I am uncommonly lucky, after all.
Shigure, get down!
Tasukete!
*BOOM*
You all right?
Hai. Kanchou... I appreciate your concern, but you know as a Kami I am mostly invincible, right?
Don't want to lose another dress, do you?
Perhaps you are right. Wait... look where we've landed! This box... Sugoi! There they are! My spare glasses!
And it only took enemy fire to find them.
They throw a match onto a hill of gunpowder.
Shigure? You've got that look again.
She opens her eyes / Watches the fleet of corpses / Smiles to kill again.
You know what you're doing.
@BATTLE
Mmm... this tea is exactly what I needed.
Shigure, may I join you?
Mochiron, Kanchou. Would you like some tea?
I'll pass for now. I just need your help with the report from the last battle.
Oh, no. I'm afraid I wouldn't be of much use to you.
What do you mean? You were amazing!
When I lose my glasses and find them again, it's a little like... dreaming? I lose the time immediately after. It's a blank in my memory. Sumimasen...
So you don't remember becoming... murderous?
I don't want to remember that. It's such an ugly side of me.
It's the side that's winning us this war.
I would prefer not to speak of it, Kanchou. Though I'm not much use without it either...

Fields.MenuText: Don't be that way. You're well on your way to being one of the Imperial Navy's most decorated ships.
All the more reason to figure out how to keep it around.
Maybe we should hide your glasses again.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, but... it's really not about me.
I don't like being that way.
Kanchou! Please don't joke about that!
Whatever the reason, you're better than you give yourself credit for. Don't forget it.
Hai. I will try not to.
*ALARM*
Oh, no... here they come now!
I know you can handle them.
I'll try.
@BATTLE
"Her doors are open / All are welcome within her / Especially her foes."
What does that mean?
Oh! Kanchou, it's... it's nothing, really.
Come on, you can tell me.
It just came to me today. But it's so pessimistic, I'm not even sure I want to keep it.

Fields.MenuText: If you understand the poem, you understand what makes you feel that way.
You're right. It's hard enough out here without adding to the tension.
I can't tell that it's pessimistic if I don't understand it.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... perhaps you are right, Kanchou. I will try to explain.
Hmm... well, surely it can't hurt if it's just between you and me.
May I try to help you understand?
It's about the sea. I was thinking of a lovely ryokan back in Uraga, and sort of drifted to our situation out here.
I don't see the connection.
Humans have traveled the ocean for thousands of years, but you were not the first to do so. There are all manner of creatures, animals... Morganas most recently.
I see what you mean. Humans had to adapt to the sea, but the monsters don't. "Especially her foes..." It's a paradox.
Actually... I was referring to humans as her foes. You bend nature to your will, rather than the other way around... and you profit most by doing so.
I see.
Sumimasen. I have offended you.
No, you haven't. I just hadn't thought of it that way.
Just a fleeting thought. Pay it no mind.
Don't sell yourself short. The Morganas are enough of a damper on morale.
I will try not to, Kanchou. Here come some now. Shall we intercept them?
After you.
@BATTLE
What's all that on the table?
My omamori! Have you seen them all, Kanchou?
Definitely not. You've got... how many is that?
Thirty-seven.
No wonder you're so lucky.
One never knows what kind of luck one might need. This one wards off bad weather. This one keeps danger away during travel. This one, for holding evil at bay.
All of which we seem to keep running into.
One cannot eliminate these negative influences entirely. I only seek to prevent them from destroying us.
It's worked so far.
I do believe I'll have to replace the weather one in the next few days... I've had it almost a year, so it's due.
If we get caught in a cyclone, I'll know who to blame.
Please accept my apology, Kanchou. I must suffer small misfortunes to prevent great tragedies.
Only a joke.
Oh... I see. Arigatō.
Wait... Funayūrei, Kanchou! This must wait.
@BATTLE
Here.
Kore wa nan desu ka?
Another good luck charm. I picked it up at a shrine in the last port.
Arigatō gozaimasu!
What does it do?

Fields.MenuText: It confers devastating accuracy.
It helps you avoid enemy fire.
It makes it easier to escape a battle gone wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: Subarashii! I have been a little hopeless at target practice lately.
How fortunate... Arigatō, Kanchou.
I feel that we may need this one day. I will keep it with me at all times!
You mentioned that you were replacing some, so I thought I'd pitch in. Why don't you wear it for the next battle?
Let's see... I'll put it in my hair with the maple leaves. It might reward me with greater protection if I keep it safe from bad weather.
We've had a run of that lately, haven't we?
I did burn the old weather protection charm recently...
Right. I'm sure that's it.
*ALARM*
Funayūrei! It's like they know you've given this to me.
You don't have anything to fear, Shigure. Fate's on your side.
So it would seem.
@BATTLE
Doing that ritual again?
Even I get tired of the rain sometimes, Kanchou. But I do want to get topside a little quicker this time.
You miss the outside, don't you?
Sort of... but really, I'm just hungry again.
Didn't we talk about fasting while on patrol?
I brought snacks this time, so I will not starve again.

Fields.MenuText: Did you make enough for two?
Why don't you come eat with me. I'd enjoy the company, at least.
Fried maple leaves aren't enough.

Fields.DialogueText: I can count again if you like.
If I move any further, I might miss something.
You might be surprised, Kanchou. Sometimes it's all I eat...
My door's always open if you need to talk. Think about it, all right?
O-okay.
*ALARM*
Oh, no. Just as I was coming up with another verse...
Poetry can wait. The Morganas won't!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, did you see this letter from Command?
I wasn't aware they had sent anything.
Sumimasen. I should have waited.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry about it. It concerns you as much as it does me.
If Command wants to communicate with us, I should be the first to know about it.
What does it say?

Fields.DialogueText: A-all right. Arigatō... I am glad I could help.
Hai. Please forgive my impulsiveness.
I think it best if you read it, Kanchou. I cannot be impartial.
Let's see...
It's a letter of commendation. Looks like your impeccable record has been noticed. Congratulations, Shigure!
Arigatō gozaimasu. It's really nothing... it's not like I can take any of the credit, anyway.
What do you mean? You're a brilliant Belle and a brilliant destroyer.
Most would just say I'm lucky. If anything, I should be thanking you for that charm.
Shigure, you know that was just...
I admire your humility, Kanchou, but you deserve every bit of Command's thanks. And mine.
If that's really how you feel...
Matsu. There are Funayūrei nearby. We must be on our guard.
Good catch.
Arigatō.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, tasukete!
Calm down, Shigure. These Morganas are no match for you or the fleet.
Not that. I've lost the book I was reading! And only a hundred pages from the end...
Haven't you read everything you own six times?
Hai, but I hadn't memorized this one yet.
Just get out there and shoot.
@BATTLE
I don't think we'll be seeing them for quite a while. Excellent work.
You really think so?
You've really got to stop doubting yourself, Shigure. You've been nothing short of a terror on the seas.
That's... good, right?
Of course it is.
Some of the other Kami haven't come through these fights as well as I have. They say I'm stealing their luck.

Fields.MenuText: That's preposterous. You're just that good.
Well, keep stealing it. It's winning us the war.
You're going to talk yourself out of a victory with that attitude.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate that you feel that way, Kanchou.
I don't want to cause my sisters any misfortune.
I know, but I just can't help but think...
Shigure, the truth is...
Well, never mind. I'll tell you later.
What? Kanchou, what's the matter?
Kanchou?
Are you angry with me?
I'm not angry. I just wish you'd be a little more honest with yourself.
I am, Kanchou. Brutally so. I know how terribly lucky I am, and that I'd just be a liability if I weren't...
Have you actually opened up that omamori I gave you?
Mochiron chigaimasu! You're not supposed to. It spoils the blessing.
Do it.
Īe! Kanchou, this is something I cannot do. Our survival depends on it!
All right, then I will.
Kanchou, don't you...
Nani?
What do you see?
There's... nothing in it? No prayer?
Do you see now? It was you all along.
But... I don't understand... if it wasn't the omamori... but that can't...
Maybe you've come through a lot of scrapes unscathed. Maybe that's luck. But even lucky people have to know how to use it.
What about the other Kami?
Forget the other Belles. You've got great things ahead of you, Shigure. You just need to have the confidence to make them happen.
I... I think there are Funayūrei approaching. What do we do?
We fight and we win, just as we always have.
Ganbatte?
Ganbatte.
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Shigure?
Hai. Only for a moment. You've never seen my quarters, have you?
I didn't want to intrude.
You have my permission.
What's all this on the walls?
The world. Fate. A little of everything.
You've got newspaper clippings, journal entries... and are these meteorological charts?
Everything is connected in some way, Kanchou. Even the gods have motives, and they must act according to patterns like you humans.

Fields.MenuText: What do Belles need with gods? You're ships.
Have you actually learned anything from all this?
You realize how ludicrous this all sounds.

Fields.DialogueText: What do humans need with gods? Whatever you need, you build. But you cannot build everything.
I have learned to look for patterns in history as in weather. I'm right more often than not.
This is a ludicrous world, isn't it?
I'm not just relying on luck to save me. I'm trying to understand when and why it will. Most Kami are good shots or great strategists...
I'm just Shigure. I just react to whatever the world hands me.
Don't we all?
It's how we react that defines us.
I've seen you in battle, especially when you've just found your glasses. You're stronger and smarter than you like to think, and that empty luck charm proves it.
I do not think you will convince me to abandon my omamori... but I will think about what you say.
There are Morganas inbound. Don't get distracted. I know that about you, too.
Heh... Never fear, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Not writing today?
I found my book, Kanchou, and not a moment too soon! I was just getting to the climax.
What's it about?
Oh... nothing.
What's it about?
It's so embarrassing...

Fields.MenuText: What's it about?
You don't have to tell me if you don't want to.
What's so embarrassing about a book you like?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... It's about a man and a woman...
But I don't like to be dishonest... fine.
Well, it's kind of... sort of... romantic?
There's this man and this woman, and they were childhood friends, and the man has been an outcast his whole life. The woman never found anyone else who understands her...
I think I might have read that one.
Oh, isn't it wonderful, Kanchou?
Ahem... I mean, it's all right. It's British. But just because we're fighting doesn't mean I can't appreciate a good book.
Especially a good romance.
It's only a story. But there's so much it has to say about human nature... and isn't love supposed to teach you about yourself, too?
A little like a battle.
More or less!
And what have you learned about yourself lately?
Well... the Funayūrei really don't like it when they miss me.
Keep making that happen. You're about to have an opportunity.
Hai! I will.
@BATTLE
Ohayōgozaimasu! Have you come to watch the omamori burn?
I wasn't aware you were planning on doing that today.
I have so many that I usually dispose of a few every couple of weeks. Out with the old year's misfortune, in with the new year's blessings.
What is it this week?
Let's see... this one was for health, that one for financial success... and that was for new friends.
So you're about to be sick, broke, and alone.
Ha! Oh, Kanchou, you shouldn't joke about such things! I'll have these replaced in port.

Fields.MenuText: If only we had our own temple...
You don't think you can do without?
Is there anything else you think you'll need?

Fields.DialogueText: I would not build one for selfish reasons.
It is not only the charms that bring me luck, but they certainly don't hurt.
Now that you mention it, I had wanted to pick up some new books.
Do you have a charm for writer's block?
I hadn't considered that, actually... but what if I did? What if I were inspired? Would I really be able to call the words my own?
You might be relaying them from the gods, but you choose how you express them.
I do, don't I? A little like using my luck to win battles.
Still sure it's luck?
Still sure it's not?
That's not really an answer.
Perhaps there is not one. If things had answers, would we write stories trying to find them?
I think so.
I can see you are skeptical. Maybe you need a battle to clear your head?
That might just help.
Ganbatte!
@BATTLE
Chilly today, isn't it?
Rainy, too. How's that weather omamori working out for you?
Every rich harvest needs a poor harvest to revitalize the field. We will have better weather later.
I'm still not sure about your superstitions.
I know they seem silly, but I don't really think of them that way. It's nice to know I'm doing something to change things for the better.
You do that every day by fighting Morganas.
Please understand, Kanchou, that there are times when I think I am just carrying out these orders. Fulfilling them in a way anyone else could.
Replaceable. Expendable. Forgettable.
Do you really let the rumors make you feel that way?
Shigure the goddess of good fortune is not the same person as Shigure the Kami. The former is a symbol... and symbols can be replaced.

Fields.MenuText: I'm never going to convince you otherwise, am I?
You're more than just a symbol.
Like omamori.

Fields.DialogueText: You do not have to.
Arigatō, Kanchou... that truly does mean a lot to me.
One day I, too, will burn to make way for something new.
Well, when those times come around... cook something. Write something. Hell, blow up Morganas. And if all else fails... you can try and talk to me.
There's more to you than just your luck, you know.
I know, Kanchou. And I will.
*ALARM*
Now, I think I must make that abundantly clear to these Funayūrei! Kanchou, you may wish to take cover.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, Kanchou! Come look what I've made!
What is it?
You know that I've always had this problem with losing my glasses. No longer!
A chain?
I have seen librarians in pictures and films use one to keep their glasses secure. Is it not a wonderful idea?

Fields.MenuText: One wonders why you hadn't thought of it before.
This ought to help out a great deal. Good idea.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn, we never get a break!
All hands to battle stations!
More Funayūrei await us...
Help me put this on, would you?
There...
Arigatō, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
